snippet: When motorcyclists have trouble meeting the physical demands of a bike, many decide that it might be time to add a third wheel.
abstract: Many aging bikers, suffering from aching joints and slowing reflexes, are abandoning traditional two-wheel motorcycles in favor of three-wheelers, super-steady and seemingly safer machines commonly known as trikes; sales of tens of thousands of trikes has helped buoy a slumping industry and kept a generation of born-to-run riders on the roads.

byline.contributor: Bob Mercer contributed reporting from Sturgis, S.D.

lead_paragraph: When motorcyclists have trouble meeting the physical demands of a bike, many decide that it might be time to add a third wheel.

headline.seo: Trikes, Three-Wheeled Motorcycles, on Rise as Riders Age
headline.main: Born to Be Wild, Aging Bikers Settle for Comfy
headline.print_headline: Born to Be Wild, Aging Bikers Settle for Comfy
